Dear Megan Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff allegedly had conversations with youth concerning his
threesomes with his wife. The staff asked the youth questions
about her body.
Investigation I called Complainant 1’s phone number. Unfortunately, there was
no one there by that name.
I spoke to Administrator 1 on 8/21/23. Allegations were discussed.
All interviews were conducted with DHHS Worker 1 at the
facility:
Interviews conducted on 8/23/23:
Youth A:
Youth A reported that Staff 1 sexually harassed her by talking to
her sexually and showing her pictures of pornography from his
phone. Youth A reported that Staff 1 talked to her about sex,
specifically, how many “body counts” she has. Youth A reported
that Staff 1 showed her pictures of himself having “threesomes”
and random pictures of female behinds. Youth A reported that
Staff 1 would call the females “hoes” as he showed the pictures on
his phone. Youth A reported Staff 1 showed her a video of girls
having sex. Youth A reported she saw these things and had
conversations with him when they were alone on the unit. Youth A
reported that she gave this information to Therapist 1, Therapist 2
and Staff 2. Youth A reported that Staff 4 was present when Staff
1 allowed her to listen to his phone. Youth A reported that Staff 4
told Staff 1 to put his phone away.
Therapist 2
Therapist 2 reported she is Youth A’s new therapist since
Therapist 1 no longer works at the facility. Therapist 2 reported
2

that on 8/17/23 Youth A disclosed that a male staff was talking to
her about his sex life with the mother of his child. Therapist 1
reported Youth A stated he asked her about her “body count” and
stated they were alone when discussing this. Therapist 1 reported
Youth A stated that Staff 1 had a threesome and cheated on his
wife. Therapist 2 reported that Youth A’s behavior has been
consistent throughout her stay at the facility.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported she is the day shift supervisor and reported
that Youth A’s behaviors are the same since she has been placed
here. Supervisor 1 reported that Staff 1 does have a phone and
does have it on him due to having a newborn baby. Supervisor 1
reported that Staff 1 checks on his daughter.
Staff 4:
Staff 4 reported that she had not seen Youth A look at Staff 1’s
phone and has never told Staff 1 to put away his phone.
Interview conducted on 9/27/23:
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported he has never showed pictures to Youth A or
videos. Staff 1 reported that some of the girls would start to have
conversations about older men and he would redirect that
conversation. Staff 1 reported that he has never been alone with
any female residents. Staff 1 reported that males are not allowed
to be alone with female residents. Staff 1 reported he has been on
his phone during working hours and acknowledges that the phone
is a distraction from line of sight.
I reviewed Staff 1’s work schedule over the month of August
2023. The following dates he was scheduled to work: 8/7, 8/9,
8/10, 8/11, 8/12, 8/13, 8/14, 8/16.
I reviewed all video footage for those dates. There was never a
time that Staff 1 was alone with Youth A. On all of those dates,
Staff 1 was with other staff and other youth. It was observed that
Staff 1 consistently had his phone out and was using it. Video
footage does not show Youth A around Staff 1 when he was
looking at his phone or using his phone or holding his phone.
I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 has an extensive
history of attendance issues. All trainings and clearances are up to
date.
3

I reviewed the Employee Behavior policy:
Prohibited Behavior:
Personal cell phone use is only permitted during scheduled breaks
and are not allowed while in the presence of clients in any
residential program.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate the allegations based on
interviews and video observation. There is evidence to validate
Staff 1 consistently using his phone during his shift. Staff 1
confirmed he was using his phone and demonstrated an
understanding of why staff are not to use their phone. The
Employee Behavior policy prohibits the unauthorized use of
phones.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
